an3.19:1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato pāpaṇiko abhabbo anadhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ adhigantuṃ, adhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ.
an3.19:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a shopkeeper who has three factors is unable to acquire more wealth or to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.

an3.19:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko pubbaṇhasamayaṃ na sakkaccaṃ kammantaṃ adhiṭṭhāti, majjhanhikasamayaṃ na sakkaccaṃ kammantaṃ adhiṭṭhāti, sāyanhasamayaṃ na sakkaccaṃ kammantaṃ adhiṭṭhāti.
an3.19:1.3.eng: It’s when a shopkeeper doesn’t carefully focus on their work in the morning, at midday, and in the afternoon.

an3.19:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi aṅgehi samannāgato pāpaṇiko abhabbo anadhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ adhigantuṃ, adhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ.
an3.19:1.4.eng: A shopkeeper who has these three factors is unable to acquire more wealth or to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.

an3.19:2.1.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu abhabbo anadhigataṃ vā kusalaṃ dhammaṃ adhigantuṃ, adhigataṃ vā kusalaṃ dhammaṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ.
an3.19:2.1.eng: In the same way, a mendicant who has three qualities is unable to acquire more skillful qualities or to increase the skillful qualities they’ve already acquired.

an3.19:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pubbaṇhasamayaṃ na sakkaccaṃ samādhinimittaṃ adhiṭṭhāti, majjhanhikasamayaṃ na sakkaccaṃ samādhinimittaṃ adhiṭṭhāti, sāyanhasamayaṃ na sakkaccaṃ samādhinimittaṃ adhiṭṭhāti.
an3.19:2.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t carefully focus on a meditation subject as a basis of immersion in the morning, at midday, and in the afternoon.

an3.19:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu abhabbo anadhigataṃ vā kusalaṃ dhammaṃ adhigantuṃ, adhigataṃ vā kusalaṃ dhammaṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ.
an3.19:2.4.eng: A mendicant who possesses these three qualities is unable to acquire more skillful qualities or to increase the skillful qualities they’ve already acquired.

an3.19:3.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato pāpaṇiko bhabbo anadhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ adhigantuṃ, adhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ.
an3.19:3.1.eng: A shopkeeper who has three factors is able to acquire more wealth or to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.

an3.19:3.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko pubbaṇhasamayaṃ sakkaccaṃ kammantaṃ adhiṭṭhāti, majjhanhikasamayaṃ …pe… sāyanhasamayaṃ sakkaccaṃ kammantaṃ adhiṭṭhāti.
an3.19:3.3.eng: It’s when a shopkeeper carefully focuses on their work in the morning, at midday, and in the afternoon.

an3.19:3.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi aṅgehi samannāgato pāpaṇiko bhabbo anadhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ adhigantuṃ, adhigataṃ vā bhogaṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ.
an3.19:3.4.eng: A shopkeeper who has these three factors is able to acquire more wealth or to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.

an3.19:4.1.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo anadhigataṃ vā kusalaṃ dhammaṃ adhigantuṃ, adhigataṃ vā kusalaṃ dhammaṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ.
an3.19:4.1.eng: In the same way, a mendicant who has three qualities is able to acquire more skillful qualities or to increase the skillful qualities they’ve already acquired.

an3.19:4.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pubbaṇhasamayaṃ sakkaccaṃ samādhinimittaṃ adhiṭṭhāti, majjhanhikasamayaṃ …pe… sāyanhasamayaṃ sakkaccaṃ samādhinimittaṃ adhiṭṭhāti.
an3.19:4.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant carefully focuses on a meditation subject as a basis of immersion in the morning, at midday, and in the afternoon.

an3.19:4.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo anadhigataṃ vā kusalaṃ dhammaṃ adhigantuṃ, adhigataṃ vā kusalaṃ dhammaṃ phātiṃ kātun”ti.
an3.19:4.4.eng: A mendicant who possesses these three qualities is able to acquire more skillful qualities or to increase the skillful qualities they’ve already acquired.”

an3.2:1.1.pli: “Kammalakkhaṇo, bhikkhave, bālo, kammalakkhaṇo paṇḍito, apadānasobhanī paññāti.
an3.2:1.1.eng: “A fool is characterized by their deeds, and an astute person is characterized by their deeds, for wisdom shines in its traces.

an3.2:1.2.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo veditabbo.
an3.2:1.2.eng: A fool is known by three things.

an3.2:1.4.eng: Bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.

an3.2:1.5.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bālo veditabbo.
an3.2:1.5.eng: These are the three things by which a fool is known.

an3.2:2.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito veditabbo.
an3.2:2.1.eng: An astute person is known by three things.

an3.2:2.3.eng: Good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.

an3.2:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito veditabbo.
an3.2:2.4.eng: These are the three things by which an astute person is known.

an3.2:3.1.eng: So you should train like this:

an3.2:3.2.pli: ‘yehi tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bālo veditabbo te tayo dhamme abhinivajjetvā, yehi tīhi dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito veditabbo te tayo dhamme samādāya vattissāmā’ti.
an3.2:3.2.eng: ‘We will shun the three things by which a fool is known, and we will undertake and follow the three things by which an astute person is known.’

an3.20:1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato pāpaṇiko nacirasseva mahattaṃ vepullattaṃ pāpuṇāti bhogesu.
an3.20:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a shopkeeper who has three factors soon acquires great and abundant wealth.

an3.20:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko cakkhumā ca hoti vidhuro ca nissayasampanno ca.
an3.20:1.3.eng: It’s when a shopkeeper sees clearly, is indefatigable, and has supporters.

an3.20:1.4.eng: And how does a shopkeeper see clearly?

an3.20:1.5.eng: It’s when a shopkeeper knows of a product:

an3.20:1.6.pli: ‘idaṃ paṇiyaṃ evaṃ kītaṃ, evaṃ vikkayamānaṃ, ettakaṃ mūlaṃ bhavissati, ettako udayo’ti.
an3.20:1.6.eng: ‘This product is bought at this price and is selling at this price. With this much investment, it’ll bring this much profit.’

an3.20:1.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko cakkhumā hoti.
an3.20:1.7.eng: That’s how a shopkeeper sees clearly.

an3.20:2.1.eng: And how is a shopkeeper indefatigable?

an3.20:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko kusalo hoti paṇiyaṃ ketuñca vikketuñca.
an3.20:2.2.eng: It’s when a shopkeeper is skilled in buying and selling products.

an3.20:2.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko vidhuro hoti.
an3.20:2.3.eng: That’s how a shopkeeper is indefatigable.

an3.20:3.1.eng: And how does a shopkeeper have supporters?

an3.20:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpaṇikaṃ ye te gahapatī vā gahapatiputtā vā aḍḍhā mahaddhanā mahābhogā te evaṃ jānanti:
an3.20:3.2.eng: It’s when rich, affluent, and wealthy householders or householders’ children know of him:

an3.20:3.3.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho bhavaṃ pāpaṇiko cakkhumā vidhuro ca paṭibalo puttadārañca posetuṃ, amhākañca kālena kālaṃ anuppadātun’ti.
an3.20:3.3.eng: ‘This good shopkeeper sees clearly and is indefatigable. They are capable of providing for their wives and children, and paying us back from time to time.’

an3.20:3.4.eng: They deposit money with the shopkeeper, saying:

an3.20:3.5.pli: ‘ito, samma pāpaṇika, bhoge karitvā puttadārañca posehi, amhākañca kālena kālaṃ anuppadehī’ti.
an3.20:3.5.eng: ‘With this, friend shopkeeper, earn money to  provide for your wives and children, and pay us back from time to time.’

an3.20:3.6.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpaṇiko nissayasampanno hoti.
an3.20:3.6.eng: That’s how a shopkeeper has supporters.

an3.20:3.7.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi aṅgehi samannāgato pāpaṇiko nacirasseva mahattaṃ vepullattaṃ pāpuṇāti bhogesu.
an3.20:3.7.eng: A shopkeeper who has these three factors soon acquires great and abundant wealth.

an3.20:4.1.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu nacirasseva mahattaṃ vepullattaṃ pāpuṇāti kusalesu dhammesu.
an3.20:4.1.eng: In the same way, a mendicant who has three qualities soon acquires great and abundant skillful qualities.

an3.20:4.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhumā ca hoti vidhuro ca nissayasampanno ca.
an3.20:4.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant sees clearly, is indefatigable, and has supporters.

an3.20:4.4.eng: And how does a mendicant see clearly?

an3.20:4.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
an3.20:4.5.eng: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

an3.20:4.6.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhumā hoti.
an3.20:4.6.eng: That’s how a mendicant sees clearly.

an3.20:5.1.eng: And how is a mendicant indefatigable?

an3.20:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āraddhavīriyo viharati akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ upasampadāya, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.
an3.20:5.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant lives with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They are strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.

an3.20:5.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vidhuro hoti.
an3.20:5.3.eng: That’s how a mendicant is indefatigable.

an3.20:6.1.eng: And how does a mendicant have supporters?

an3.20:6.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ye te bhikkhū bahussutā āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā te kālena kālaṃ upasaṅkamitvā paripucchati paripañhati:
an3.20:6.2.eng: It’s when from time to time a mendicant goes up to those mendicants who are very learned—inheritors of the heritage, who have memorized the teachings, the monastic law, and the outlines—and asks them questions:

an3.20:6.3.eng: ‘Why, sir, does it say this? What does that mean?’

an3.20:6.4.pli: Tassa te āyasmanto avivaṭañceva vivaranti, anuttānīkatañca uttānīkaronti, anekavihitesu ca kaṅkhāṭhāniyesu dhammesu kaṅkhaṃ paṭivinodenti.
an3.20:6.4.eng: Those venerables reveal what is hidden, clarify what is unclear, and dispel doubt regarding the many doubtful matters.

an3.20:6.5.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu nissayasampanno hoti.
an3.20:6.5.eng: That’s how a mendicant has supporters.

an3.20:6.6.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu nacirasseva mahattaṃ vepullattaṃ pāpuṇāti kusalesu dhammesū”ti.
an3.20:6.6.eng: A mendicant who possesses these three qualities soon acquires great and abundant skillful qualities.”

an3.21:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
an3.21:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

an3.21:1.3.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ca samiddho āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu.
an3.21:1.3.eng: Then Venerable Saviṭṭha and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita went up to Venerable Sāriputta, and exchanged greetings with him.

an3.21:1.4.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ samiddhaṃ āyasmā sāriputto etadavoca:
an3.21:1.4.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side and Venerable Sāriputta said to Venerable Saviṭṭha,

an3.21:2.1.pli: “Tayome, āvuso samiddha, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.21:2.1.eng: “Reverend Saviṭṭha, these three individuals are found in the world.

an3.21:2.3.eng: The direct witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.

an3.21:2.4.pli: Ime kho, āvuso, tayo puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.21:2.4.eng: These are the three individuals found in the world.

an3.21:2.5.pli: Imesaṃ, āvuso, tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ katamo te puggalo khamati abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā”ti?
an3.21:2.5.eng: Of these three individuals, who do you believe to be the finest?”

an3.21:3.1.pli: “Tayome, āvuso sāriputta, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.21:3.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, these three individuals are found in the world.

an3.21:3.3.eng: The direct witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.

an3.21:3.4.pli: Ime kho, āvuso, tayo puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.21:3.4.eng: These are the three individuals found in the world.

an3.21:3.5.pli: Imesaṃ, āvuso, tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ yvāyaṃ puggalo saddhāvimutto, ayaṃ me puggalo khamati imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
an3.21:3.5.eng: Of these three individuals, I believe the individual freed by faith to be finest.

an3.21:3.7.eng: Because this individual’s faculty of faith is extraordinary.”

an3.21:4.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ mahākoṭṭhikaṃ etadavoca:

an3.21:4.2.pli: “tayome, āvuso koṭṭhika, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.21:4.2.eng: “Reverend Koṭṭhika, these three individuals are found in the world.

an3.21:4.4.eng: The direct witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.

an3.21:4.5.pli: Ime kho, āvuso, tayo puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.21:4.5.eng: These are the three individuals found in the world.

an3.21:4.6.pli: Imesaṃ, āvuso, tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ katamo te puggalo khamati abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā”ti?
an3.21:4.6.eng: Of these three individuals, who do you believe to be the finest?”

an3.21:5.1.pli: “Tayome, āvuso sāriputta, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.21:5.1.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, these three individuals are found in the world.

an3.21:5.3.eng: The direct witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.

an3.21:5.4.pli: Ime kho, āvuso, tayo puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.21:5.4.eng: These are the three individuals found in the world.

an3.21:5.5.pli: Imesaṃ, āvuso, tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ yvāyaṃ puggalo kāyasakkhī, ayaṃ me puggalo khamati imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
an3.21:5.5.eng: Of these three individuals, I believe the direct witness to be finest.

an3.21:5.7.eng: Because this individuals’s faculty of immersion is extraordinary.”

an3.21:6.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca:

an3.21:6.2.pli: “tayome, āvuso sāriputta, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.21:6.2.eng: “Reverend Sāriputta, these three individuals are found in the world.

an3.21:6.4.eng: The direct witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.

an3.21:6.5.pli: Ime kho, āvuso, tayo puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.21:6.5.eng: These are the three individuals found in the world.

an3.21:6.6.pli: Imesaṃ, āvuso, tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ katamo te puggalo khamati abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā”ti?
an3.21:6.6.eng: Of these three individuals, who do you believe to be the finest?”

an3.21:7.1.pli: “Tayome, āvuso koṭṭhika, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.21:7.1.eng: “Reverend Koṭṭhika, these three individuals are found in the world.

an3.21:7.3.eng: The direct witness, the one attained to view, and the one freed by faith.

an3.21:7.4.pli: Ime kho, āvuso, tayo puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.21:7.4.eng: These are the three individuals found in the world.

an3.21:7.5.pli: Imesaṃ, āvuso, tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ yvāyaṃ puggalo diṭṭhippatto, ayaṃ me puggalo khamati imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
an3.21:7.5.eng: Of these three individuals, I believe the individual attained to view to be finest.

an3.21:7.7.eng: Because this individual’s faculty of wisdom is extraordinary.”

an3.21:8.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantañca samiddhaṃ āyasmantañca mahākoṭṭhikaṃ etadavoca:
an3.21:8.1.eng: Then Sāriputta said to Saviṭṭha and Mahākoṭṭhita,

an3.21:8.2.pli: “byākataṃ kho, āvuso, amhehi sabbeheva yathāsakaṃ paṭibhānaṃ.
an3.21:8.2.eng: “Each of us has spoken from the heart.

an3.21:8.3.pli: Āyāmāvuso, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamissāma; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocessāma.
an3.21:8.3.eng: Come, reverends, let’s go to the Buddha, and tell him about this.

an3.21:8.4.pli: Yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṃ dhāressāmā”ti.
an3.21:8.4.eng: As he answers, so we’ll remember it.”

an3.21:8.5.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā ca samiddho āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko āyasmato sāriputtassa paccassosuṃ.

an3.21:8.6.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca samiddho āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
an3.21:8.6.eng: Then Sāriputta, Saviṭṭha, and Mahākoṭṭhita went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side.

an3.21:8.7.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto yāvatako ahosi āyasmatā ca samiddhena āyasmatā ca mahākoṭṭhikena saddhiṃ kathāsallāpo taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavato ārocesi.
an3.21:8.7.eng: Then Sāriputta told the Buddha of all they had discussed.

an3.21:9.1.eng: “In this matter, Sāriputta, it’s not easy to categorically declare that

an3.21:9.2.pli: ‘ayaṃ imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā’ti.
an3.21:9.2.eng: one of these three individuals is finest.

an3.21:9.3.pli: Ṭhānañhetaṃ, sāriputta, vijjati yvāyaṃ puggalo saddhāvimutto svāssa arahattāya paṭipanno, yvāyaṃ puggalo kāyasakkhī svāssa sakadāgāmī vā anāgāmī vā, yo cāyaṃ puggalo diṭṭhippatto sopassa sakadāgāmī vā anāgāmī vā.
an3.21:9.3.eng: In some cases, an individual freed by faith is practicing for perfection, while the direct witness and the one attained to view are once-returners or non-returners.

an3.21:10.1.pli: Na khvettha, sāriputta, sukaraṃ ekaṃsena byākātuṃ:
an3.21:10.1.eng: In this matter, it’s not easy to categorically declare that

an3.21:10.2.pli: ‘ayaṃ imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā’ti.
an3.21:10.2.eng: one of these three individuals is finest.

an3.21:10.3.pli: Ṭhānañhetaṃ, sāriputta, vijjati yvāyaṃ puggalo kāyasakkhī svāssa arahattāya paṭipanno, yvāyaṃ puggalo saddhāvimutto svāssa sakadāgāmī vā anāgāmī vā, yo cāyaṃ puggalo diṭṭhippatto sopassa sakadāgāmī vā anāgāmī vā.
an3.21:10.3.eng: In some cases, a direct witness is practicing for perfection, while the one freed by faith and the one attained to view are once-returners or non-returners.

an3.21:11.1.pli: Na khvettha, sāriputta, sukaraṃ ekaṃsena byākātuṃ:
an3.21:11.1.eng: In this matter, it’s not easy to categorically declare that

an3.21:11.2.pli: ‘ayaṃ imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā’ti.
an3.21:11.2.eng: one of these three individuals is finest.

an3.21:11.3.pli: Ṭhānañhetaṃ, sāriputta, vijjati yvāyaṃ puggalo diṭṭhippatto svāssa arahattāya paṭipanno, yvāyaṃ puggalo saddhāvimutto svāssa sakadāgāmī vā anāgāmī vā, yo cāyaṃ puggalo kāyasakkhī sopassa sakadāgāmī vā anāgāmī vā.
an3.21:11.3.eng: In some cases, one attained to view is practicing for perfection, while the one freed by faith and the direct witness are once-returners or non-returners.

an3.21:12.1.pli: Na khvettha, sāriputta, sukaraṃ ekaṃsena byākātuṃ:
an3.21:12.1.eng: In this matter, it’s not easy to categorically declare that

an3.21:12.2.pli: ‘ayaṃ imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā’”ti.
an3.21:12.2.eng: one of these three individuals is finest.”

an3.22:1.1.eng: “These three patients are found in the world.

an3.22:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco gilāno labhanto vā sappāyāni bhojanāni alabhanto vā sappāyāni bhojanāni, labhanto vā sappāyāni bhesajjāni alabhanto vā sappāyāni bhesajjāni, labhanto vā patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ alabhanto vā patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ neva vuṭṭhāti tamhā ābādhā.
an3.22:1.3.eng: In some cases a patient won’t recover from an illness, regardless of whether or not they get suitable food and medicines, and a capable carer.

an3.22:2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco gilāno labhanto vā sappāyāni bhojanāni alabhanto vā sappāyāni bhojanāni, labhanto vā sappāyāni bhesajjāni alabhanto vā sappāyāni bhesajjāni, labhanto vā patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ alabhanto vā patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ vuṭṭhāti tamhā ābādhā.
an3.22:2.1.eng: In some cases a patient will recover from an illness, regardless of whether or not they get suitable food and medicines, and a capable carer.

an3.22:3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco gilāno labhantova sappāyāni bhojanāni no alabhanto, labhantova sappāyāni bhesajjāni no alabhanto, labhantova patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ no alabhanto vuṭṭhāti tamhā ābādhā.
an3.22:3.1.eng: In some cases a patient can recover from an illness, but only if they get suitable food and medicines, and a capable carer, and not if they don’t get these things.

an3.22:4.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ gilāno labhantova sappāyāni bhojanāni no alabhanto, labhantova sappāyāni bhesajjāni no alabhanto, labhantova patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ no alabhanto vuṭṭhāti tamhā ābādhā, imaṃ kho, bhikkhave, gilānaṃ paṭicca gilānabhattaṃ anuññātaṃ gilānabhesajjaṃ anuññātaṃ gilānupaṭṭhāko anuññāto.
an3.22:4.1.eng: Now, it’s for the sake of the last patient—who will recover only if they get suitable food and medicines, and a capable carer—that food, medicines, and a carer are prescribed.

an3.22:4.2.pli: Imañca pana, bhikkhave, gilānaṃ paṭicca aññepi gilānā upaṭṭhātabbā.
an3.22:4.2.eng: But also, for the sake of this patient, the other patients should be looked after.

an3.22:4.3.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo gilānā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.22:4.3.eng: These are the three kinds of patients found in the world.

an3.22:5.1.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tayome gilānūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an3.22:5.1.eng: In the same way, these three individuals similar to patients are found in the world.

an3.22:5.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo labhanto vā tathāgataṃ dassanāya alabhanto vā tathāgataṃ dassanāya, labhanto vā tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ savanāya alabhanto vā tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ savanāya neva okkamati niyāmaṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an3.22:5.3.eng: Some people don’t step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, regardless of whether or not they get to see a Realized One, and to hear the teaching and training that he proclaims.

an3.22:6.1.pli: Idha, pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo labhanto vā tathāgataṃ dassanāya alabhanto vā tathāgataṃ dassanāya, labhanto vā tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ savanāya alabhanto vā tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ savanāya okkamati niyāmaṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an3.22:6.1.eng: Some people do step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, regardless of whether or not they get to see a Realized One, and to hear the teaching and training that he proclaims.

an3.22:7.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo labhantova tathāgataṃ dassanāya no alabhanto, labhantova tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ savanāya no alabhanto okkamati niyāmaṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an3.22:7.1.eng: Some people can step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, but only if they get to see a Realized One, and to hear the teaching and training that he proclaims, and not when they don’t get those things.

an3.22:8.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ puggalo labhantova tathāgataṃ dassanāya no alabhanto, labhantova tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ savanāya no alabhanto okkamati niyāmaṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ, imaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalaṃ paṭicca dhammadesanā anuññātā.
an3.22:8.1.eng: Now, it’s for the sake of this last individual that teaching the Dhamma is prescribed, that is, the one who can step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, but only if they get to see a Realized One, and to hear the teaching and training that he proclaims.

an3.22:8.2.pli: Imañca pana, bhikkhave, puggalaṃ paṭicca aññesampi dhammo desetabbo.
an3.22:8.2.eng: But also, for the sake of this individual, the other people should be taught Dhamma.

an3.22:8.3.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo gilānūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an3.22:8.3.eng: These are the three individuals similar to patients found in the world.”

an3.23:1.1.eng: “These three individuals are found in the world.

an3.23:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sabyābajjhaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti, sabyābajjhaṃ vacīsaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti, sabyābajjhaṃ manosaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti.
an3.23:1.3.eng: Firstly, a certain individual makes hurtful choices by way of body, speech, and mind.

an3.23:1.4.pli: So sabyābajjhaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharitvā, sabyābajjhaṃ vacīsaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharitvā, sabyābajjhaṃ manosaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharitvā sabyābajjhaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.
an3.23:1.4.eng: Having made these choices, they’re reborn in a hurtful world,

an3.23:1.5.pli: Tamenaṃ sabyābajjhaṃ lokaṃ upapannaṃ samānaṃ sabyābajjhā phassā phusanti.

an3.23:1.6.pli: So sabyābajjhehi phassehi phuṭṭho samāno sabyābajjhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayati ekantadukkhaṃ, seyyathāpi sattā nerayikā.
an3.23:1.6.eng: Touched by hurtful contacts, they experience hurtful feelings that are exclusively painful—like the beings in hell.

an3.23:2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo abyābajjhaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti, abyābajjhaṃ vacīsaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti, abyābajjhaṃ manosaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti.
an3.23:2.1.eng: Furthermore, another individual makes pleasing choices by way of body, speech, and mind.

an3.23:2.2.pli: So abyābajjhaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharitvā, abyābajjhaṃ vacīsaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharitvā, abyābajjhaṃ manosaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharitvā abyābajjhaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.
an3.23:2.2.eng: Having made these choices, they are reborn in a pleasing world,

an3.23:2.3.pli: Tamenaṃ abyābajjhaṃ lokaṃ upapannaṃ samānaṃ abyābajjhā phassā phusanti.

an3.23:2.4.pli: So abyābajjhehi phassehi phuṭṭho samāno abyābajjhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayati ekantasukhaṃ, seyyathāpi devā subhakiṇhā.
an3.23:2.4.eng: Touched by pleasing contacts, they experience pleasing feelings of perfect happiness—like the gods of universal beauty.

an3.23:3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi kāyasaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti, sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi vacīsaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti, sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi manosaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti.
an3.23:3.1.eng: Furthermore, another individual makes both hurtful and pleasing choices by way of body, speech, and mind.

an3.23:3.2.pli: So sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi kāyasaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharitvā, sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi vacīsaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharitvā, sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi manosaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharitvā sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi lokaṃ upapajjati.
an3.23:3.2.eng: Having made these choices, they are reborn in a world that is both hurtful and pleasing,

an3.23:3.3.pli: Tamenaṃ sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi lokaṃ upapannaṃ samānaṃ sabyābajjhāpi abyābajjhāpi phassā phusanti.
an3.23:3.3.eng: where hurtful and pleasing contacts strike them.

an3.23:3.4.pli: So sabyābajjhehipi abyābajjhehipi phassehi phuṭṭho samāno sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi vedanaṃ vedayati vokiṇṇasukhadukkhaṃ, seyyathāpi manussā ekacce ca devā ekacce ca vinipātikā.
an3.23:3.4.eng: Touched by both hurtful and pleasing contacts, they experience both hurtful and pleasing feelings that are a mixture of pleasure and pain—like humans, some gods, and some beings in the underworld.

an3.23:3.5.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an3.23:3.5.eng: These are the three individuals found in the world.”

an3.24:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these three individuals are very helpful to another.

an3.24:1.3.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalaṃ āgamma puggalo buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato hoti, dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato hoti, saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato hoti;
an3.24:1.3.eng: The individual who has enabled you to go for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.

an3.24:1.4.pli: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo imassa puggalassa bahukāro.
an3.24:1.4.eng: This individual is very helpful to another.

an3.24:2.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ puggalaṃ āgamma puggalo ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti;
an3.24:2.1.eng: Furthermore, the individual who has enabled you to truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

an3.24:2.2.pli: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo imassa puggalassa bahukāro.
an3.24:2.2.eng: This individual is very helpful to another.

an3.24:3.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ puggalaṃ āgamma puggalo āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati;
an3.24:3.1.eng: Furthermore, the individual who has enabled you to realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with your own insight due to the ending of defilements.

an3.24:3.2.pli: ayaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo imassa puggalassa bahukāro.
an3.24:3.2.eng: This individual is very helpful to another.

an3.24:3.3.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo puggalā puggalassa bahukārā.
an3.24:3.3.eng: These are the three individuals who are very helpful to another individual.

an3.24:4.1.pli: Imehi ca pana, bhikkhave, tīhi puggalehi imassa puggalassa natthañño puggalo bahukāroti vadāmi.
an3.24:4.1.eng: And I say that there is no-one more helpful to another than these three individuals.

an3.24:4.2.pli: Imesaṃ pana, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ puggalānaṃ iminā puggalena na suppatikāraṃ vadāmi, yadidaṃ abhivādanapaccuṭṭhānaañjalikammasāmīcikammacīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānuppadānenā”ti.
an3.24:4.2.eng: And I also say that it’s not easy to repay these three individuals by bowing down to them, rising up for them, greeting them with joined palms, and observing proper etiquette for them; or by providing them with robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.”

an3.25:1.1.eng: “These three individuals are found in the world.

an3.25:1.3.pli: Arukūpamacitto puggalo, vijjūpamacitto puggalo, vajirūpamacitto puggalo.
an3.25:1.3.eng: An individual with a mind like an open sore, an individual with a mind like lightning, and an individual with a mind like diamond.

an3.25:1.4.eng: And who has a mind like an open sore?

an3.25:1.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo
an3.25:1.5.eng: It’s an individual who is irritable and bad-tempered.

an3.25:1.6.pli: appampi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
an3.25:1.6.eng: Even when lightly criticized they lose their temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and they display annoyance, hate, and bitterness.

an3.25:1.7.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, duṭṭhāruko kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭito bhiyyoso mattāya āsavaṃ deti;
an3.25:1.7.eng: They’re like a festering sore, which, when you hit it with a stick or a stone, discharges even more.

an3.25:1.8.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idhekacco puggalo kodhano hoti upāyāsabahulo
an3.25:1.8.eng: In the same way, an individual is irritable and bad-tempered.

an3.25:1.9.pli: appampi vutto samāno abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
an3.25:1.9.eng: Even when lightly criticized they lose their temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and they display annoyance, hate, and bitterness.

an3.25:1.10.eng: This is called an individual with a mind like an open sore.

an3.25:2.1.eng: And who has a mind like lightning?

an3.25:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
an3.25:2.2.eng: It’s an individual who truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

an3.25:2.3.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, cakkhumā puriso rattandhakāratimisāyaṃ vijjantarikāya rūpāni passeyya;
an3.25:2.3.eng: They’re like a person with keen eyes in the dark of the night, who sees by a flash of lightning.

an3.25:2.4.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idhekacco puggalo ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
an3.25:2.4.eng: In the same way, an individual truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

an3.25:2.5.eng: This is called an individual with a mind like lightning.

an3.25:3.1.eng: And who has a mind like diamond?

an3.25:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
an3.25:3.2.eng: It’s an individual who realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

an3.25:3.3.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, vajirassa natthi kiñci abhejjaṃ maṇi vā pāsāṇo vā;
an3.25:3.3.eng: It’s like a diamond, which can’t be cut by anything at all, not even a gem or a stone.

an3.25:3.4.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idhekacco puggalo āsavānaṃ khayā …pe… upasampajja viharati.
an3.25:3.4.eng: In the same way, an individual realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. …

an3.25:3.5.eng: This is called an individual with a mind like diamond.

an3.25:3.6.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an3.25:3.6.eng: These are the three individuals found in the world.”
